title: On the optimality of coin-betting for mean estimation
abstract:
Confidence sequences are sequences of confidence sets that adapt to incoming
data while maintaining validity. Recent advances have introduced an algorithmic
formulation for constructing some of the tightest confidence sequences for
bounded real random variables. These approaches use a coin-betting framework,
where a player sequentially bets on differences between potential mean values
and observed data. This letter establishes that such coin-betting formulation
is optimal among all possible algorithmic frameworks for constructing
confidence sequences that build on e-variables and sequential hypothesis
testing.
